business.headline: India's $64 billion US trade at risk as tensions with Washington escalateIndia faces its most serious diplomatic crisis with the US in years after Trump imposed the highest tariffs among Asian peers on goods imported from India, even before any penalty.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as US trade tension; RBI rate pause hit sentimentThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 166.26 points lower to end at 80,543.99, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 75.35 points to end at 24,574.20.

Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta on why large cap is the new debtTraditionally, people invested in debt, like fixed deposits or bonds, when they wanted safety. They turned to equity, like stocks, when they were willing to take more risk for higher returns. But that line is getting blurry.

Is social media ruining investing for Gen Z?Social media is reshaping how young Indians invest. With financial influencer or 'finfluencer' on the rise, traditional financial literacy is being replaced by reels and short YouTube videos.

Trump says don't know anything about US-Russia imports. But here's what we knowUS President Donald Trump recently said he was unaware that the United States still imports goods like uranium and fertilisers from Russia. His comments came after India defended its oil trade with Moscow.

Can AI manage your investment portfolio?AI is rapidly changing how we invest. From portfolio tracking to fund recommendations, it's already doing the heavy lifting. But can it take full charge of your investments, and, should it?

From easier claim rules to Jan-dhan scheme: RBI's 3 key reforms for common manOne of the major announcements is aimed at easing the process for families to claim money or valuables from bank accounts, lockers, or safe custody after the account holder passes away.

Will US tariffs hit India's economy? What RBI Governor saidThe three-day meeting concluded with Governor Sanjay Malhotra outlining the central bank's views on inflation, growth, and importantly, the growing global trade tensions triggered by tariff announcements, especially by the United States.

Forgot to e-verify your ITR? Here's what to do to avoid penaltiesEven though the new ITR deadline is now September 15, 2025 for several taxpayers, the 30-day e-verification window begins the moment you file your return and not from the due date.

Should you hold or sell NSDL shares after stock market listing? Details hereWhile NSDL may not offer sharp near-term upside post listing, many analysts see it as a core holding in India's market infrastructure play, particularly as digital finance expands and retail participation deepens.

NSDL shares debut with 10% premium over IPO issue priceNSDL's Rs 4,012 crore initial public offering was entirely an offer for sale (OFS) involving 5.01 crore equity shares. The issue saw robust demand from all investor segments, with an overall subscription of 41.02 times.

RBI keeps key lending rate steady at 5.5% amid global trade uncertaintyThe RBI MPC sighted the global tensions and trade uncertainty in keeping key lending rates unchanged. The MPC also decided to continue with a neutral stance.

Sensex, Nifty off to shaky start amid Trump tariff threat, RBI rate decisionThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 65.70 points to 80.644.34 at 9:40 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 28.40 points to trade at 24,620.

RBI MPC announcement today: Will your home loan get cheaper?With interest rates already lowered three times in 2025, homebuyers and borrowers across the country are waiting to see if there is any further relief coming their way.
RBI MPC rate decision on August 6: Time, expectations, and key updatesRBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra will present the monetary policy statement today. Check time, expectations, and key updates.

Anil Ambani likely to be summoned again by ED for questioning: SourcesAnil Ambani faced questioning by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with an alleged Rs 17,000 crore loan fraud case. The questioning lasted for several hours, with sources indicating that he is likely to be summoned again within seven to ten days.

Anil Ambani seeks 10 days from ED to provide documents in fraud cases: SourcesThe 66-year-old industrialist was summoned to the ED headquarters in New Delhi, where his statement was recorded under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA).

Want higher FD returns? Compare these 1-year rates before investingAmong the different time periods you can choose, a one-year FD is especially attractive. It gives you decent interest without locking up your money for too long.

Why Estonia is the new favourite for Indian startupsAccording to an investment banker, top business leaders have already adopted Estonia's unique e-residency, allowing them to do business across Europe.

Sensex ends over 308 points lower, Nifty below 24,700; Titan up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex ended the session 308.47 points lower at 80,710.25, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 73.20 points to settle at 24,649.55. All the broader market indices ended the trading session in negative territory after Trump said he would impose more tariffs on India over Russian oil imports.
How one tax mistake could have cost a real estate seller Rs 1.87 lakhReal estate sellers often ignore deductions that can help reduce capital gains tax.

Why the government wants to blend more ethanol with petrolBy March 2025, the government hit its E20 blending target—20% ethanol in petrol—five years ahead of schedule. Average blending levels stood at 17.98% in February 2025, up from 14.6% the year before, according to official data.

Filing ITR for the first time? Do this before anything elseThe last date to file your ITR for the financial year 2024–25 is September 15, 2025, so it's best to begin early and avoid the last-minute rush.

PAN 2.0 to go live in 18 months: What it means and how it affects youThe Rs 1,435 crore project will focus on simplifying taxpayer registration services and improving the overall experience through a new, unified online platform.

Why is Trump threatening India over Russian oil? Here's the real reasonIs Donald Trump really upset about India buying Russian oil, or is this just a calculated move to boost US energy exports, appease oil lobbyists, and reshape global trade flows?

Who is P B Balaji, Jaguar Land Rover's new CEO?The decision was confirmed in a stock exchange filing on August 4, 2025. Balaji's appointment marks a major shift, as he moves from a financial leadership role to the driver's seat of one of the world's most recognised car brands.

Sensex tumbles 400 points: Why is the stock market falling today?The S&P BSE Sensex was down 394.03 points to 80,614.50 at around 9:59 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 121.90 points to 24,600.85. Broader markets also mirrored the nervousness on Dalal Street, with mid- and small-cap indices under pressure.

Why insurance regulator fined Policybazaar Rs 5 crore? All you need to knowThe IRDAI noted that various insurance products were promoted as "top" or "best" in a manner that appeared biased and lacked substantiation.

Sensex, Nifty fall after Trump's fresh tariff threat over Russian oil importsThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 156.96 points to 80,861.76 around 9:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 30.80 points to trade at 24,691.95. Most of the broader market indices also mirror the weak sentiments on Dalal Street.

Government's big remark as ethanol-blended petrol has car owners fumingIn a post on X (formerly Twitter), the ministry responded to recent media reports questioning whether E20 fuel could damage older vehicles or degrade the driving experience. Citing multiple studies and expert assessments, it stated that E20 is both safe and beneficial.

Anil Ambani at ED office for questioning in multiple fraud casesThe summons against Anil Ambani followed a massive crackdown by the ED last month, during which the agency searched 35 premises linked to some top executives of the Reliance Group.

Thousands of Boeing fighter jet workers go on strike after rejecting contract offerOver 3,200 workers have walked off the job in what marks their first strike in nearly 30 years. The affected workers, primarily based in the St. Louis region, are responsible for assembling and maintaining military aircraft, including the F-15 fighter jet and various missile systems.

After Mumbai, Tesla to open showroom in Delhi's Aerocity on August 11The Delhi showroom will be opened at Worldmark 3 in Aerocity for customers. Like the Mumbai showroom, this showroom is also expected to serve as a display and customer experience centre, offering visitors a chance to view the vehicles up close and understand Tesla's technology.

Tesla's brand loyalty took a hit after Musk backed Trump as US President: ReportThe data shows Tesla's customer loyalty peaked in June 2024, when 73% of Tesla-owning households in the market for a new car bought another Tesla, according to an S&P analysis of vehicle-registration data in all 50 states.

Sunjay Kapur's death: Mother alleges foul play, transnational conspiracy in letterSunjay Kapur passed away on June 12 while playing polo at the Duke's Ground of the Old Guards Polo Club in Surrey, UK. His death was officially described as a heart attack. However, his mother Rani now claims there may be more to the story.

How to activate UAN via UMANG app to access EPFO servicesEPFO now requires everyone to activate their UAN through the UMANG app using Aadhaar-based face authentication to access provident fund services.

Tesla offers Elon Musk $29 billion deal to stay onboardIn 2018, Tesla had promised Musk a huge $50 billion pay package if he hit certain performance goals. But earlier this year, a court in Delaware cancelled that deal, saying the company's board didn't do a fair job protecting shareholders when they approved it.

ED's crackdown on Anil Ambani, web of bank frauds: All you need to knowThe fraud case centres around unpaid loans amounting to nearly Rs 17,000 crore, which were taken by various firms linked to Anil Ambani. Officials are now trying to trace the money trail and who were all involved in diverting it.

Are you unemployed or studying? Should you file taxes this yearIf your total income is below the basic exemption limit, Rs 2.5 lakh under the old tax regime or Rs 3 lakh under the new one, you are not legally required to file an ITR. This means many students and unemployed individuals fall outside the mandatory filing bracket.
Sensex closes 418 points higher, Nifty above 24,700; Tata Steel ends 4% upThe S&P BSE Sensex added 418.81 points to close at 81,018.72, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 157.40 points to end at 24,722.75.

entertainment.headline: Rajinikanth arrives in Hyderabad with daughter Aishwarya. Viral videoRajinikanth was seen at the Hyderabad airport along with his daughter, Aishwarya, on Wednesday. A video of the two is now going viral on social media.

Adivi Sesh, Sonu Sood and Raghav Juyal express grief over Uttarkashi tragedyIn the aftermath of the Uttarkashi cloudburst tragedy, several celebrities, including Sonu Sood, Adivi Sesh and Raghav Juyal, shared their concern. They expressed their condolences and extended support on social media.

KL Rahul shares adorable photos with baby Evaarah and family from England tripKL Rahul shared heartwarming pictures from his family time in England, including a moment with his daughter Evaarah and bonding with brother-in-law Ahan Shetty.

After being thrown out by Salman Khan, Priyanka Jagga to make BB 19 comebackPriyanka Jagga shared photos from her Bigg Boss 10 journey on Facebook and claimed that she will be appearing in Bigg Boss 19, which will be hosted by Salman Khan.

Raanjhanaa and the AI controversy explained: Who owns creative freedom?What happens when technology rewrites emotion? 'Raanjhanaa's' AI-altered re-release sparks a fierce debate on creative ownership, artistic consent, and the future of storytelling in cinema.

Andhera: Surveen Chawla and Prajakta Koli's supernatural series to premiere in AugustSurveen Chawla, Prajakta Koli's upcoming series 'Andhera' is slated to premiere on August 14. The Prime Video supernatural show is directed by Raaghav Dar.

Prabhas's The Raja Saab runtime revealed, producer eyes December releaseProducer TG Vishwa Prasad has revealed that the initial cut of Prabhas's 'The Raja Saab' runs over four-and-a-half hours. With the film currently in its final stages, the team is now targeting a December 5 release.

Kingdom makers deny disrespecting Sri Lankan Tamils: No such scenes in filmVijay Deverakonda's 'Kingdom', directed by Gowtam Tinnanuri, was criticised for demeaning Sri Lankan Tamils in the film. Sithara Entertainments, the production house, issued a statement denying the claims.

Mukesh Khanna backs SRK amid National Award row: Award for Jawan is justifiedShah Rukh Khan's National Award win for 'Jawan' received mixed reactions, with some people questioning it. Veteran actor Mukesh Khanna supported SRK, saying he has worked hard for 40 years and truly deserves the award.

Jennifer Aniston, hypnotist Jim Curtis enjoy dinner date with Jason BatemanHollywood actor Jennifer Aniston is reportedly in a relationship with hypnotherapist Jim Curtis. The pair were spotted holidaying together in Mallorca in July.

Exclusive | Viveck Vaswani backs SRK's National Award win, Gowariker's integrityViveck Vaswani supports Shah Rukh Khan's National Award win for Jawan. He also defends Ashutosh Gowariker's integrity amid controversy over the jury's decision.
Varun Dhawan cuts a cake as he celebrates Border 2 wrapActor Varun Dhawan cut a cake and celebrated the 'Border 2' wrap. Several pictures and videos from the celebration have emerged online.

Walking Dead actor Kelley Mack dies of rare brain cancer at 33In January, actor Kelley Mack, known for her performance in 'Walking Dead', revealed that she had been diagnosed with diffuse midline glioma, a rare form of astrocytoma cancer. She died at the age of 33 on August 2.

Parineeta trailer: Vidya Balan-starrer restored in 8K ahead of re-releaseAhead of the re-release of 'Parineeta', a new trailer was unveiled by the makers. Now restored in 8K, the trailer retains the charm of the film released 20 years ago. The film, which marked actor Vidya Balan's acting debut, will be re-released in theatres on August 29.

Protests against Vijay Deverakonda's Kingdom over portrayal of Sri Lankan TamilsVijay Deverakonda's film Kingdom has sparked protests in Tamil Nadu by pro-Tamil groups condemning its portrayal of Sri Lankan Tamils. Distributors seek police protection as screenings face disruptions in Madurai and Trichy.

Ahaan Panday greets fans as Saiyaara becomes box office hit, video goes viralAhaan Panday was seen happily greeting fans and paparazzi after the massive success of his debut film 'Saiyaara', which crossed Rs 500 crore worldwide. The romantic musical has now become the second-highest-grossing Indian film of the year.

Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi Ep 8: Tulsi begs Angad to punish her with broom'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' moves on to make a point about patriarchy in Indian households, and how gender roles need to be reversed. Angad, Tulsi's son, walks free amid the ongoing accident case.

Justin Bieber introduces son Jack Blues in emotional music video YukonJustin Bieber has released the music video for his new song 'Yukon', featuring touching moments with his 11-month-old son, Jack Blues. The video offers fans a heartfelt glimpse into his family life with wife Hailey.

Rubina Dilaik backs Deepika Padukone's demand for fixed work hours: Not unrealisticActor Rubina Dilaik came out in support of Deepika Padukone's demand for fixed eight-hour workdays, calling it a much-needed change in the industry. She shared her own struggles with long working hours and said she would implement better systems if she ever turns producer.

general news.headline: PM Modi to visit China for SCO summit, first trip since 2019PM Modi's visit comes at a time when Donald Trump has targeted the Brics nations for buying oil from Russia and for what the US President claims is a grouping that challenges the hegemony of the dollar.

India secretly funding Russia war machine? 9 facts Trump is not telling youThe narrative that India's growing oil imports from Russia are fuelling the Kremlin's actions in Ukraine exposes not only media misrepresentation but also a pattern of global double standards. We answer your questions.

Uttarkashi tragedy has meteorologists scrambling for answersInitial reports from the Uttarakhand government attributed the disaster to a cloudburst, a phenomenon characterised by extremely heavy rainfall over a short period, typically exceeding 100 mm in an hour.

UP minister calls floods Ganga Ma blessings, gets amma's savage replyUP Minister Sanjay Nishad, during a visit to a flood-hit village in Kanpur Dehat, called the rising waters a "blessing" from Ganga Ma. But an elderly woman's sharp quick retort turned the minister's remark into a public embarrassment. Opposition parties, including the Congress and the SP, slammed the minister for insensitivity.
Dharavi revamp: Can Gautam Adani transform Asia's largest slum?How the Adani Group's Rs 2.5 lakh crore redevelopment and rehabilitation plan promises to play out for Dharavi's 1.2 million residents

Gaming apps, not betting: Vijay Deverakonda clarifies after ED appearanceAfter appearing before the ED on August 6, Vijay Deverakonda said he was called for clarification over promoting gaming apps. He clarified that there was a probe into the alleged illegal promotion of betting platforms. Several other celebrities have also been summoned.

Trump says don't know anything about US-Russia imports. But here's what we knowUS President Donald Trump recently said he was unaware that the United States still imports goods like uranium and fertilisers from Russia. His comments came after India defended its oil trade with Moscow.

PM inaugurates Kartavya Bhavan. Ministries get a swanky new addressKartavya Bhavan-3, which was inaugurated by the Prime Minister, is part of the government's ambitious project to bring central ministries and departments under one roof.

80 years of Hiroshima: When Japan burned, but the Soviets got the messageOn August 6, 1945, the US dropped the first atomic bomb on Hiroshima. But it wasn't about Japan alone. It was the fear of German nukes, overlooked warnings, and Cold War power plays that drove the US decision, one that Einstein regretted playing a part in later.
Flipkart Freedom Sale: Tablets Get Their Biggest Price Drop of the YearFor buyers looking to invest in a new device, this could be the best chance before the festive season arrives.

Deadly Uttarakhand flash flood cuts off key roads, dozens missing Live UpdatesRescue operations in Uttarkashi have been severely hampered by continuous rain. The Meteorological Department has issued a red alert for heavy rain today in several districts of the state.

Pakistani mercenaries fighting in Ukraine war amid closer Russia-Pak ties?Amid the economic distress in Pakistan, mercenaries from the country are fighting for Moscow in the Ukraine-Russia war, says Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Pakistan has denied the allegations, but the reports fuel doubts about Islamabad's agenda as it develops closer ties with Russia.

Why everyone's talking about gut health: The rise of personalised probioticsGut health has become a major focus in India's booming wellness industry, driven by personalised probiotic plans and microbiome testing. Supermarket stores and pharmacies are packed with probiotic drinks, capsules with multi-strain bacteria, enzyme-rich supplements, and even botanicals - all promising digestive bliss.

Mohammed Siraj storms to career-best ICC Test ranking after Oval heroicsMohammed Siraj has risen to 15th in the ICC Test bowling rankings after a remarkable series in England. His performance signals a strong bowling future for India amid the absence of Jasprit Bumrah.

Trump is Making China Cheaper AgainTrump's tariff of up to 40% on transshipped goods and levies across Southeast Asia has left China a winner. Manufacturers and exporters are asking why they should move out of China. Ironically, Trump's trade war might be doing the unthinkable — making Chinese factories and products cheaper.

Could a glacial lake outburst be behind the Uttarkashi tragedy?Early assumptions blamed a cloudburst for the destruction in Uttarkashi, a region frequently battered by intense monsoon events. However, recent meteorological and satellite data tell a different story.

Move over fake weddings, ticketed shaadis are the next big thingForget dancing at fake weddings, now you can actually buy a ticket and be part of a real one. The trend is catching on in France, and guess what? It's happening in India too.

Mira Murati said no to Zuckerberg, he launched $1.5B war to hire her top engineerNever bet against Mark Zuckerberg, or so goes the saying in Silicon Valley. After spurned by Mira Murati, Zuckerberg has now launched a war with over a billion-dollar chest to try to break and lure engineers away from Mira's Thinking Machines.

Indian-origin professor caught in child-sex sting in San DiegoAn Indian-origin associate professor at UC San Diego is under investigation after a viral video surfaced showing him being confronted in a vigilante sting operation for allegedly trying to meet a minor for sexual activity. Police have not filed charges but confiscated Nisarg Shah's phone. The varsity and the police said the probe is on, but Shah has denied the allegations.
Traditional vs modern engineering: What gen Z is choosing and why it mattersAs engineering evolves from concrete to code, Gen Z is redefining the future of India's most-loved degree.

Great Barrier Reef turning into a graveyard from biggest bleaching eventThe fifth mass extension of the Great Barrier Reef in Australia is signalling an urgent need for global climate action and reef protection.

Will US tariffs hit India's economy? What RBI Governor saidThe three-day meeting concluded with Governor Sanjay Malhotra outlining the central bank's views on inflation, growth, and importantly, the growing global trade tensions triggered by tariff announcements, especially by the United States.

Can AI manage your investment portfolio?AI is rapidly changing how we invest. From portfolio tracking to fund recommendations, it's already doing the heavy lifting. But can it take full charge of your investments, and, should it?

Army Colonel radioes in from Uttarkashi ground zero: Camp hit, rescue ops onA cloudburst over the Kheerganga river triggered massive flash floods and a landslide in Uttarkashi's Dharali village, sweeping away homes, damaging an Army camp, and leaving dozens feared trapped.

Kajol, Vatsal Sheth celebrate joint birthday at Ishita Dutta's home. PicsKajol and Vatsal Sheth celebrated their shared birthday with an intimate party hosted by Ishita Dutta at her Mumbai home, joined by close friends and family, including Yug Devgn. The duo cut five cakes together, while Ajay Devgn posted fun birthday wishes for both.

Bharatnatyam legend Geeta Chandran's disciple Anvita Jain's Arangetram in DelhiBharatnatyam legend Geeta Chandran's disciple Anvita Jain's Arangetram ceremony is scheduled at the Chinmaya Mission Auditorium in New Delhi. The event highlights tradition and artistic discipline under the guidance of a cultural icon.

Rajinikanth arrives in Hyderabad with daughter Aishwarya. Viral videoRajinikanth was seen at the Hyderabad airport along with his daughter, Aishwarya, on Wednesday. A video of the two is now going viral on social media.

Adivi Sesh, Sonu Sood and Raghav Juyal express grief over Uttarkashi tragedyIn the aftermath of the Uttarkashi cloudburst tragedy, several celebrities, including Sonu Sood, Adivi Sesh and Raghav Juyal, shared their concern. They expressed their condolences and extended support on social media.

sports.headline: Shubman Gill nominated for ICC's Player of the Month award after England heroicsIndia captain Shubman Gill has been nominated for the ICC Men's Player of the Month award for July following his stellar performances in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, which ended in a dramatic 2-2 draw between India and England.

How Oval curator Lee Fortis turned hero from villain in five daysJust days after a heated exchange with India coach Gautam Gambhir saw him painted as a villain, Oval curator Lee Fortis was back in the spotlight — this time clinking glasses with his ground staff after a Test match for the ages.

Shubman looked composed against the most attacking Test team: TendulkarENG vs IND: The legendary Sachin Tendulkar heaped praise on Shubman Gill after India won the Oval Test by six runs to draw the five-match Test series 2-2 against England.

Shubman Gill leaves behind Kohli comparisons: Aakash Chopra hails star batterAakash Chopra heaped praise on Shubman Gill for his incredible run during the England tour and also said that the Indian captain left behind Virat Kohli comparisons with his performances at No.4.

Siraj gets rousing welcome in Hyderabad; grand felicitation planned for Oval heroIndia fast bowler Mohammed Siraj was given a rousing reception upon his arrival back in his hometown Hyderabad after a match-winning performance in the fifth Test against England at the Oval.

Sesko picks Manchester United as Newcastle United miss out again: ReportRB Leipzig striker Benjamin Sesko is set to join Manchester United after snubbing Newcastle United in the transfer battle, according to the latest media reports.

Yashasvi Jaiswal breaks into top 5 of Test batting rankings, Gill out of top 10India batter Yashasvi Jaiswal broke into the top five of ICC Test batting rankings after his magnificent century in the fifth Test against England at the Oval. On the other hand, Shubman Gill moved out of top ten.

Mohammed Siraj storms to career-best ICC Test ranking after Oval heroicsMohammed Siraj has risen to 15th in the ICC Test bowling rankings after a remarkable series in England. His performance signals a strong bowling future for India amid the absence of Jasprit Bumrah.

Manage Siraj's workload just like Bumrah: RP Singh's advice to BCCIRP Singh urges BCCI to manage Mohammed Siraj's workload like Jasprit Bumrah's after his Oval heroics, warning of injury risk from overuse in Tests. Siraj was the star of the show as he picked up 23 wickets in the five Tests he played.

Karma hits instantly: R Ashwin on Ben Stokes labelling injury substitutes as jokeENG vs IND: Ravichandran Ashwin has questioned England's attitude towards injured players and urged Ben Stokes to show more empathy, bringing up the idea of karma and calling out the use of words like 'joke' and 'ridiculous'.

Brook stunned by Gambhir's decision to award him Player of the Series over RootEngland batter Harry Brook revealed that he felt undeserving of the Player of the Series award of the England vs India five-match Test series. Brook scored 481 runs from five matches at an average of 53.44.

Yashasvi Jaiswal breaks into top 5 of Test batting rankings, Gill out of top 10India batter Yashasvi Jaiswal broke into the top five of ICC Test batting rankings after his magnificent century in the fifth Test against England at the Oval. On the other hand, Shubman Gill moved out of top ten.

Siraj was the star of the show as he picked up 23 wickets in the five Tests he played.

Karma hits instantly: R Ashwin on Ben Stokes labelling injury substitutes as jokeENG vs IND: Ravichandran Ashwin has questioned England's attitude towards injured players and urged Ben Stokes to show more empathy, bringing up the idea of karma and calling out the use of words like 'joke' and 'ridiculous'.

Brook stunned by Gambhir's decision to award him Player of the Series over RootEngland batter Harry Brook revealed that he felt undeserving of the Player of the Series award of the England vs India five-match Test series. Brook scored 481 runs from five matches at an average of 53.44.

Chennai Grand Masters postponed to August 7 after fire at tournament venueChennai Grand Masters 2025 postponed to August 7 after a fire at the Hyatt Regency venue. All players, including Arjun Erigaisi, are safe, say organisers.

Mohammed Siraj has heart of a lion: McCullum in awe of India's fighting spiritEngland head coach Brendon McCullum has hailed India fast bowler Mohammed Siraj for his fighting spirit and praised India for a scripitng a sensatiuonal comeback in the series.

Mohammed Siraj ready to be India's bowling leader with or without Bumrah: ChappellGreg Chappell backs Mohammed Siraj as the leader of India's pace attack, saying he's ready to take charge with or without Jasprit Bumrah in the side after Oval heroics. Siraj was adjudged as the Player Of The Match for his performance which helped India win the game.

Shubman Gill ready to take over ODI captaincy from Rohit Sharma: Mohammad KaifFormer India cricketer-turned commentator Mohammad Kaif feels Shubman Gill is ready to take over ODI captaincy from Rohit Sharma after his heroics in England.

Shubman Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal in contention for Asia Cup call-up: ReportIndia's Test captain Shubman Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal and Sai Sudharsan are in contention to make it to the squad for the upcoming Asia Cup 2025, which will begin on September. All three men remain in contention despite the West Indies Test series later on in September.

A foxy affair: Unexpected pitch invader halts The Hundred opener at Lord'sThe Hundred opener between the London Spirit and the Oval Invincibles had an unexpected guest as a fox made its way to the Lord's cricket ground on Tuesday, August 6.

From 4–1 to 2–2: How England let a glorious Test series win slip awayThe Test series between England and India ended in a 2-2 draw, but the hosts could well have won it 4-1. Having squandered golden opportunities for victory at Old Trafford and the Kennington Oval, England now must face the harsh reality of making some big changes with the Ashes on the horizon.

Mukesh Kumar is a bowler for all formats: Ganguly on pacer's England Test snubFormer India captain Sourav Ganguly said that Mukesh Kumar is well-suited to bowl across all three formats and backed the pacer to be in contention for a spot in India's squad for the 2025 Asia Cup.

Shubman Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal in contention for Asia Cup call-up: ReportIndia's Test captain Shubman Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal and Sai Sudharsan are in contention to make it to the squad for the upcoming Asia Cup 2025, which will begin on September. All three men remain in contention despite the West Indies Test series later on in September.

A foxy affair: Unexpected pitch invader halts The Hundred opener at Lord'sThe Hundred opener between the London Spirit and the Oval Invincibles had an unexpected guest as a fox made its way to the Lord's cricket ground on Tuesday, August 6.

From 4–1 to 2–2: How England let a glorious Test series win slip awayThe Test series between England and India ended in a 2-2 draw, but the hosts could well have won it 4-1. Having squandered golden opportunities for victory at Old Trafford and the Kennington Oval, England now must face the harsh reality of making some big changes with the Ashes on the horizon.

Mukesh Kumar is a bowler for all formats: Ganguly on pacer's England Test snubFormer India captain Sourav Ganguly said that Mukesh Kumar is well-suited to bowl across all three formats and backed the pacer to be in contention for a spot in India's squad for the 2025 Asia Cup.

India's Jasprit Bumrah dilemma: Protect the body or preserve his magicJasprit Bumrah and the Indian team management might be on the brink of facing an impossible choice with trade-offs coming in both ends as the premier pacer continues to be binded down by limitations in terms of appearances or workload.

Siddhant Sharma and Harsh Tyagi's journey fuels Outer Delhi Warriors in DPL 2025From the dusty maidans of Delhi to the leadership roles in DPL 2025, Siddhant Sharma and Harsh Tyagi have walked a path built on patience, perseverance, and passion. Their journeys reflect the unseen grind behind every rising star in Indian domestic cricket.

Pant makes heartfelt gesture, pays college fees for underprivileged studentRishabh Pant extended a generous helping hand to support the education of a student from a financially struggling family in Karnataka's Bagalkot district. After word reached about the student's need, Pant paid the fees directly to the college.

Siraj a role model for pacers on managing workload: Sourav GangulyENG vs IND: Former Indian captain Sourav Ganguly, in an interview with Aaj Tak, heaped praise on Mohammed Siraj, who finished the Test series against England as the leading wicket-taker with 23 scalps to his name from five games.

Sourav Ganguly to enter race for Bengal cricket's presidential electionFormer Indian captain Sourav Ganguly confirmed to India Today that he will be submitting his nomination ahead of the Annual General Meeting (AGM) to contest for the post of President of the Cricket Association of Bengal (CAB).

Ganguly lauds Gautam Gambhir as Gill, Pant step up in absence of Big 2Former India captain Sourav Ganguly lauded the batting depth of the Indian team after the side drew 2-2 against England in the 5-match Test series.

Boys were brilliant throughout last two months: Gambhir on England tourENG vs IND: Head coach of the Indian cricket team, Gautam Gambhir, hailed the entire team's performances throughout their recent tour of England. The Indian team went on to level the series 2-2 with a miraculous win at the Oval.

KKR is where I belong: Abhishek Nayar on his exit from Indian teamFormer India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar was sacked from his role in the aftermath of Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Nayar broke his silence on the matter after joining WPL side UP Warriorz as their head coach.

Bangladesh name preliminary squad for Asia Cup 2025, Netherlands T20I seriesBangladesh have named a 25‑member preliminary squad for the upcoming Asia Cup and the three-match T20I series against the Netherlands.

Manchester United submit first bid for RB Leipzig's Benjamin Sesko: ReportThe race intensifies for RB Leipzig's Benjamin Sesko as Manchester United have reportedly submitted their first bid for the Slovenian striker, who is also being pursued by Newcastle United.

Mohammed Siraj's heroic spell at Oval reminded me of Kapil Dev: Yograj SinghFormer India cricketer Yograj Singh revealed that Mohammed Siraj's phenomenal spell in the fifth Test against England at the Oval, reminded him of Kapil Dev. Siraj was adjudged Player of the Match for picking nine wickets in the match.

BCCI unlikely to allow India stars to pick and choose games going forwardThe BCCI is set to introduce a rule that will prevent star players from selectively choosing matches in which to rest. On Monday, India drew their five-match series against England after winning the Oval Test by six runs.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
